name: Comfort Suites Maingate East

reviews.text: Even though the reviews of this hotel were so good, I was still wary coming here. I needn't have worried. This hotel can really give a lesson to so many others - everything they do, they do it well. The Ritz it ain't, but if you're looking for a spacious, clean and welcoming oasis at the end of a hot Orlando day, you can't do much better than this.
reviews.title: Believe the reviews - this is GOOD

reviews.text: The rooms are large enough - we had two Queen-size beds, a smallish living area and a spacious bathroom. The "kitchen area" was very small and had no cutlery, but it has a fridge and you're not going to want to eat in anyway.
reviews.title: noisy but nice!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are cleaned fastidiously - every day without fail. Can't fault that - very clean thoughout.
reviews.title: Great for the Budget!

likes.liked: — Save money here to spend at theme parks.

reviews.text: Concierge not a problem.
reviews.title: Not what it is cracked up to be

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'd also say the breakfast is great considering it's gratis - again if you're expecting haute cuisine, stroll on, but it's decent enough.
reviews.title: Great hotel in a convenient location.

likes.disliked: — Pool bar could have done with more experienced bar staff.

reviews.title: Great value - clean, clean, clean!
reviews.text: Friendly staff, clean and spacious rooms, great continental breakfast - change of menu every day. For those who had any complaints in other reviews- keep in mind this is a 2.5 star hotel not a three hundred a night hotel. The location to the parks was great - much better than the I-4 locations. The old town Kissimee shopping area was good for a side destination. The pool/hot tub area was nicer than most hotels - it was open 24 hours a day. There was a basic drink and hot food snack bar by the pool open in the evenings - very convenient if you didn't want to leave the hotel after the parks. The room/carpet was older - but very clean. We would definitely stay again.

reviews.title: very disappointed overall...
reviews.text: I have been a "frequent stayer" at the Comfort/Choice Hotel brands for a while now. They do give out frequent and good reward points. So with that in mind I booked this place online for an affordable 1 night stay for a wedding we were attending nearby. I called the place first to see when it was last updated and was told most rooms had been recently refurbished. I was told to make a request online for a refurbished room. So I did. I also requested an early check in. The day prior to arrival I called to confirm all of this. I was told the early arrival would not be granted until the next day (our arrival date). I called that morning and was spoken to very rudely by the woman. She said she would not know if I could check in early until 1:00pm! That was the time we needed to be in the room to change our clothes before attending the wedding at 2:30! We arrived at 1:15pm and there was no one to be found at the front desk. The lobby smelled like fried foods (gross). I was not impressed. Finally a man came and starting spewing excuses as to why we could not check in early. He said the hotel had been full the night before. I calmly asked again, was there not a single room ready? He finally relented and gave us a room, but it was very dated, not updated, and the flooring and bedding was old and gross. The bed was awful and I could not sleep. I really do not know if they truly have any updated rooms as all the rooms on our floor looked to be the same. It was a bad experience overall, and I would not return.

reviews.title: Great place to stay with the Softball Team
reviews.text: Our daughter played softball at the ESPN Wide World of Sports Complex. This hotel was about 6 miles from the Disney attractions.It was a perfect location in that it wasn't busy with Disney traffic. And there are lots of restaurants, stores, and attractions nearby.

reviews.title: Good value for Disney Parks
reviews.text: Check out Old Town for an interesting experience! The girls actually did the swing ride for $35 best ride EVER! Band and Car show on the weekend- cheap prices and fun time! Too cold for swimming but the girls did get in! The Nike Clearance store has shoes for around $30. We ate at the Steak n Shake it is open 24 hours! Girls went to Universal for Harry Potter- wasn't quite what they expected-enjoyed butterbeer, $11.50 with mug to bring home. Adventureland was good fun for teenagers. We went to Cocoa Beach, it took about 45 min. to get there, easy and fast. Went to Ron Jons, walked the beach and had clam chowder on the pier at the little restaurant spot.

reviews.title: Great stay, again
reviews.text: just finished a 6-night stay here 10/27/10 to 11/01/10 and I would say this place is a solid 4-stars.

reviews.title: great value
reviews.text: Stayed for 2 weeks...found it to be very clean, great location and the added value of the breakfast made us want to stay. The kids loved the nice heated pool and it's close to everything. My only complaint was a security complaining that I was disciplining my grandson too loudly! We were in our room people, guess he was bored.

reviews.title: This is the place to stay for Disneyworld & Universal!!
reviews.text: This hotel was absolutely amazing! The suites we clean and updated, the pool was great and breakfast couldn't have been better. Not too many items you could have wanted that weren't there. The beds were confortable and well appointed. Bought all of my attraction tickets at the hotel. Great prices and freebies! We didn't use the shuttle because it only ran at certain times, so we paid the $10 parking fee and drove to the parks, which also allowed us to come and go as we pleased. The staff gave me any and all discounts that could be applied and we stayed for 8 nights for around $900 with breakfast included. Next time we visit Disney and Universal, this is where we will be.

reviews.title: excellent stay
reviews.text: Totally agree with the person from Southampton said on report dated 20th Sept, following stay in August, may have been same time.

reviews.title: Great hotel!
reviews.text: Rooms

reviews.title: Great Honeymoon
reviews.text: queen suite - great size for 2 adults 2 children, beds v.comfortable. Good view on 6th floor of Old Town & fireworks at 9 o'clock. Some previous comments about light under door, no problem when you are asleep!! Even though the hotel was undergoing refurb this block had not been done so yet, but was not showing any real sign of age it still looked fresh.Having microwave & fridge was an added bonus.
The hotel was great. We got a clean room overlooking the pool with two queen beds, a sofa & table, microwave, fridge and extra sink , a great breakfast, and a shuttle to the parks.
reviews.title: Great Place to Stay, clean & close to everything.

reviews.text: The shuttle wasn't very convenient though, and it completely forgot to come out to Disney HollyWood studios the one night to pick people up so fortunately after a long wait, another bus company stopped and asked us why we were still there and offered to take us to our hotel.
reviews.title: Great Value.

reviews.text: We had rented a car for the week anyway so instead of the shuttle we just drove ourselves which is what I prefer anyway. I'm not interested in arranging my day based on some bus, shuttle, or train schedule and I'm way too frugal to waste money on a taxi. A 4 door Toyota rental car from the airport was $154.00 incl taxes for the week. It cost $18.25 for gas for the week, including the 160 mile roundtrip to Tampa. Gas was $2.47 a GALLON !! Cheap Cheap Cheap. (Aug 2010) Busch Gardens in Tampa was just over an hour away. Interstate 4 is three lanes each way and 70 - 75 mph was avg speed.
reviews.title: Absolutely super place to stay - lovely pool!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are maps and brochures everywhere, with discount coupons to restaurants, attractions, etc The restaurants are usually 10% off. Many of the restaurants are All You Can Eat...and the amount of food is overwhelming. Way too much food..!
reviews.title: Excellent hotel for an excellent price

reviews.text: The hotel has a desk downstairs with all the tickets and packages to choose from for Disney, Seaworld, Universal, etc. The prices are slightly discounted from the main gate, and the woman at the desk seemed honest and up front. She was willing to say what was a good deal, what wasn't so great, and what the actual daily gate prices were without the combo pkgs. She also had combo packages available for Disney that we didn't see online. I found selecting the ticket packages and options at the hotel desk offered more choices and flexibilty than trying to predetermine and choose online weeks ahead of actually getting there.
reviews.title: Good Location, but Shuttle could be much better stay away from Pool Side as its noisy

reviews.text: We stayed at this property recently and as we had the chance to visit Kissimmee again, we didn’t hesitate to book at the Comfort Suites again. Good job we did as those days were fully booked! We even tried to add another night to our stay but unfortunately that wasn’t possible as there were no vacancies.
reviews.title: Another visit and once again it was great!

likes.liked: — The amazing upgraded room and the pool

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we arrived the check-in was quick and efficient and we were able to go to our room quickly. When we got to our room we were surprised by the fact that, in spite of booking a standard room, it appeared like we’d been upgraded to a two-room suite with two bathrooms and oodles of space! The main bedroom with a king bed was so comfortable and the main bathroom even had a Jacuzzi function. Our little boy slept in the main living room area (sofa bed provided) with his own enormous TV and acres to run around it. It was great!
reviews.title: What a great place!

reviews.text: There was a lovely touch where an amenity basket was left for us (full of yummy goodies) as well as a personally addressed note welcoming us back to the hotel. It was a lovely touch and we were certainly impressed.
reviews.title: Great Place/Great Value

likes.liked: — comfort and the expanded continental breakfost

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel itself provides an excellent breakfast (included) and has a great heated pool that is open 24 hours. There are also concierges for things like booking dinner or buying park tickets, as well as a fitness room and a small games room. It is located next to Kissimmee’s Old Town and this made an interesting place to visit on Sunday night when there is a classic car “cruise” going on. But the hotel itself is far enough from Old Town to remain quiet and relaxing.
reviews.title: Great stay

reviews.text: We certainly enjoyed our stay at the Comfort Suites and look forward to going back again – even without the amazing upgrade!
reviews.title: Who need sleep anyway?

reviews.text: The front desk staff never smiled. The female bartender at the pool bar was unpleasant and aloof. The room was nothing like the pictures on the website, but it was more than adequate for our needs. The pool was very nice, as was the jacuzzi. The Old Town "amusement" park is kind of sleazy looking, and some of the area around there is a bit on the rundown side. But everything you could possibly need is within a couple of miles east or west on 192, and it was just a few minutes away from MGM, Epcot, and Animal Kingdom.
reviews.title: Nice place for the price

likes.disliked: — Front desk staff and bartender; Old Town was sleazy

reviews.text: Good stuff: This hotel is a great location if you're headed to Disney World - easy to get to and in/out to the freeways - walking distance to many restaurants (Red Lobster, Denny's Logan's Roadhouse, McDonald's, Pizza Hut...). Great breakfast buffet to get your day started - Mickey Mouse waffles with or without chocolate chips. Pool, fitness room, hot tub were good. Our stay was pleasant enough. Lots of parking for rental cars. Nice decor.
reviews.title: Good hotel but not platinum

reviews.text: Not so good stuff: Elevators are extremely slow - lots of times it was faster to use the stairs, which isn't convenient with small children. The hide-a-bed mattress was shot - almost falling off the frame and the springs dug into your back (for kids only and then maybe only). The dryer on our floor was out of operation the entire stay - a platinum winner should be fixing things and replacing worn items quickly. Be careful when making phone calls--we phoned to put our names on a waitlist for Joe's Crab Shack (1/4 mile from the Comfort Suites) and were charged over $9 for long-distance! Wouldn't recommend the food from Barricuda Bart's although we saw a few people eating their pizza and it looked okay. Staff were marginally friendly - tired of tourists?
reviews.title: Good Value, Nice Hotel

reviews.text: This is a nice hotel conveniently located near all of the Disney theme parks. It is behind Old Town in Kissimmee, but it is not seedy like the others surrounding that part of town. Everything in Old Town is within walking distance with the exception of a grocery store which is across the street and down two blocks (you have to cross 192 to access it and it's a death trap!)
reviews.title: Was going to stay here -- but didn't --

reviews.text: The room itself was nice. The ceilings were high which made the room look more spacious and the bathrooms were very large. The carpets could use a good steam cleaning, but besides that it was nice. We only found one cockroach on the wall in the morning which is great for Orlando, and a good hotel.
reviews.title: Good choice if you are on a budget!

likes.liked: — It was clean and comfortable with lots of perks!
likes.disliked: — Shuttle bus out of the way from disneyworld

reviews.text: We booked the Comfort Suites on the strength of Trip Advisor reviews vi Virgin Holidays. It is in a good location, close to all the parks; around 15 mins to Disney off the 192. We stayed on the 6th Floor overlooking the pool at the rear of hotel. There are 2 lifts which are a nuisance as they take so long. The room was clean and the daily housekeeping was excellent with clean towels every day. We had a suite with 2 x queen beds and a sofa bed. There was a TV in the room which had plenty of channels including the Disney one. We never experienced any noise from other guests. Although the suites had a coffee maker and microwave, there is no crockery in the room. We used the coffee maker a few times as there is complimentary coffee which is replaced daily. The pool is lovely and heated. The bar next to the pool is handy when coming back from a day at the parks and does serve food such as pizzas, burgers etc. We left the key in the room one day and when asking reception for a replacement he issued one without checking any ID which was worrying. The reception staff weren't very helpful and I found them rude but apart from the key, didn't have any contact with them again. The free breakfast was great but does get monotonous over 14 days. From the selection from muffins, cereal, juice, tea and coffee, waffles, scrambled egg, sausages, beans, fruit and toast, there is always something to eat. There was free WiFi from the lobby area / pool which was handy. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone. As a family of four with children of 8 and 14, we all enjoyed the location which was a stones throw to Old Town.
reviews.title: Excellent Value, location and Cleanliness

reviews.text: The comfort suites was very clean, comfortable, and a nice treat for the children. The pool area was kid friendly and the breakfast was the best I've had at a choice property. The rooms were spacious and in good condition. Overall, a very nice stay with the family.
reviews.title: pleasant stay

reviews.text: This Hotel was very good value, it came with a buffet breakfast everyday, must say it was the somethings every other day but was plentiful.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.text: This Hotel was well located for all Disney Parks and Universal and was within walking distance of lots of restaurants.
reviews.title: Usually great...NOT this time!

reviews.text: Must say that the lifts are very slow and the front desk staff seem a little unhelpful!!
reviews.title: The Service was Terrible!

reviews.text: We choose this hotel as a direct result of reading the reviews and hotel info on Trip Advisor and we were not dissapointed. The room was
reviews.title: Good Location

reviews.text: clean and had everything we needed, the maid service was excellent. The breakfast was good but as the hotel was full you need to get down
reviews.title: Stay Here for a great time in Orlando

reviews.text: early to get a table. As the previous poster mentioned the hotel
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: was a little noisy at night due to the number of teenagers but you could get this problem at any hotel. Our real negative was that we were approached whilst at the breakfast table one morning by one of the timeshare people who seemed a little annoyed that we hadn't been to see her but we made it clear that we weren't interested and weren't bothered again.
reviews.title: VERY basic

reviews.text: The hotel's location is ideal for visiting the Disney Parks and we would recommend this hotel aany visiting the parks.
reviews.title: Wonderful!

likes.disliked: — Beds were a bit too firm

aka: Comfort Suites Maingate East Hotel Kissimmee
description: This Kissimmee hotel is located just 2 miles from Walt Disney World Resort and is a Disney Good Neighbor Hotel. Enjoy the great amenities at this hotel in Kissimmee like flat screen TV's, quad charging stations, complimentary deluxe hot & cold buffet breakfast and complimentary scheduled shuttle to all major Orlando theme parks. Relax by the outdoor pool or whirlpool spa any time day or night, or have a drink at Barracuda Bart’s poolside bar. The hotel is close to Osceola Heritage Park, Silver Spurs Arena and Disney ESPN Wide World of Sports. Bring the family to Comfort Suites Maingate East where great memories are made!
